page.title: 10FARMING IN LONGNEWTON
page.content: {WHITE HOUSE FARM}IN LONGNEWTON HAS{145 {ACRES}OF LAND.THERE ARE FIELDS OF WHEAT,BARLEY AND OATS.THERE ARE{2 ACRES OF POTATOES,MANGOLS AND TURNIPS FOR FEEDING THE ANIMALS IN WINTER.WE SELL SOME OF THE CROPS THAT WE GROW FOR MILLING AND KEEP SOME FOR FEED.THE {OATS}AND{BARLEY}ARE USED FOR FEEDING OUR ANIMALS. WE HAVE{53 EWES,2 TUPS',66 LAMBS,33 {BEAST, 53 HENS,3 GEESE,5 DUCKS}AND A {COW}.SOME OF OUR ANIMALS GO TO MARKET TO BE SOLD.{LAMBS}ARE BOUGHT BY THE BUTCHERS.EWES ARE KEPT FOR BREEDING. THE COW GIVES MILK TO FEED YOUNG CALVES AND FOR US TO DRINK{.HEIFER {BEAST}ARE KEPT TO CALVES THEN THEY ARE SOLD AT THE MARKET AS MILKING COWS. IF IT IS A BULL CALF,IT IS SOLD WHEN IT IS ABOUT{12}MONTHS OLD.{THE BY-PASS DISSECTS THE FARM AND SEPARATES THE HOUSE AND THE MILKING PARLOUR.
